meanings.definition: Capable of being drawn out or stretched.
meanings.sent1: The rubber band was very tractile, allowing it to stretch far.
meanings.sent2: The dough was so tractile that it could be pulled into long strands.
meanings.sent3: The silly putty was so tractile that it could even be stretched into funny shapes.
meanings.sent4: Her patience was as tractile as a rubber band, always able to be stretched.
meanings.sent5: The spider's web was incredibly tractile, able to expand and contract with ease.

meanings.definition: Able to be molded or shaped easily.
meanings.sent1: The clay was very tractile, allowing the artist to shape it effortlessly.
meanings.sent2: The playdough is so tractile that even young children can mold it into various forms.
meanings.sent3: The tractile material made sculpting a breeze, like playing with a stress ball.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was as tractile as clay, easily molded by new experiences.
meanings.sent5: The flexible wire was incredibly tractile, bending into intricate designs with ease.

meanings.definition: Having the quality of being easily extended or manipulated.
meanings.sent1: The fabric was tractile, allowing the tailor to adjust it as needed.
meanings.sent2: The rubber gloves were tractile, making it easy to put them on and take them off.
meanings.sent3: The tractile material behaved like a playful puppy, always ready to be shaped.
meanings.sent4: His words were as tractile as clay, easily twisted to suit his needs.
meanings.sent5: The branches of the tree were incredibly tractile, bending gracefully in the wind.
